lead_paragraph: King tides, which frequently flood South Florida even when the sun shines, are the most blatant example of the interplay between rising seas and the alignment of the moon, sun and Earth.

byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Fort Lauderdale, and Frances Robles from Key Largo.
byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and FRANCES ROBLES

headline.print_headline: Worsened by Climate Change, ‘King Tides’ Transform Florida Life
headline.main: Intensified by Climate Change, ‘King Tides’ Change Ways of Life in Florida

snippet: King tides, which frequently flood South Florida even when the sun shines, are the most blatant example of the interplay between rising seas and the alignment of the moon, sun and Earth....
abstract: Residents of South Florida are living with reality that climate change is impacting sea levels; by 2100, rising sea levels could submerge 12.5 percent of Florida’s homes during so-called king tides, clearest example of interplay between rising seas and alignment of moon, sun and Earth; some areas of South Florida now flood regularly even in dry weather.
